item.description:
@R.I.P_RSC wrote:

R.I.P RSC:

I’m not sure if this is related to cloudflare, and if this deserves its own thread, but the site has be awfully slow lateley. Loading pages, quoting using the ‘quote’ button etc… It takes ages to load, and the quoting sometimes doesn’t even work.

NVM that, was a problem from my side.

item.title: Viglink?
item.dc:creator: @silabsoft RuneAgent
item.description:
@silabsoft wrote:

http://www.alexa.com/siteinfo/moparisthebest.com
http://www.alexa.com/siteinfo/moparisthebest.com

says otherwise and they pull data directly from analytic and adsense so pretty accurate.

imho it has to do with the placement of the advertisements try moving them they rarely pull correlating content. Sometimes I get some chinese gay singles website, other times I get hong kong singles. If I’m lucky i’ll get an advertisement for smokin mills.

Read full topic

item.title: Viglink?
item.dc:creator: @tL tL
item.description:
@tL wrote:

Miss Silabsoft:

I would also like to know how you are doing so terrible with adsense? I’ve always had less traffic than your site yet have had much higher profits if those numbers you throw into the post are correct.

mitb.com is visited by like 20 people regularly, most of which probably have adblock. Though I have just set moparisthebest and moparscape set as excluded domains for adblock. I do it for many of the other sites I visit if the ads aren’t obtrusive, never occurred to me to do it for here.

Read full topic

item.title: Viglink?
item.dc:creator: @silabsoft RuneAgent
item.description:
@silabsoft wrote:

Davidi2:

I am also confused as to why you wouldn’t just take a portion of the SSP money to pay for the costs, especially considering the low profit you are getting from this for what it does. I opted out, but personally I would hate having any of my posts contain links that I didn’t put in there, it could change the dynamic of a post for anyone else that reads it, even if I don’t see the link myself.

that may be tax related, also moparisthebest this site meets the requirements for tribalfusion and cpm for a sites with kids is the way to go. my CPM rates had been around $2.75 when I last used it. that was under the technology category. However you will need to do a little work on the main portion of the website as a simple forum is unacceptable make your home page link to all the various content you have available take a little time and write a simple theme and submit an application.

Read full topic

item.title: Viglink?
item.dc:creator: @R.I.P_RSC R.I.P RSC
item.description:
@R.I.P_RSC wrote:

I’m not sure if this is related to cloudflare, and if this deserves its own thread, but the site has be awfully slow lateley. Loading pages, quoting using the ‘quote’ button etc… It takes ages to load, and the quoting sometimes doesn’t even work.

On-topic: This form of putting links in text luckily isn’t as annoying as those where a complete text balloon popups when you mouseover. And I guess that this site pretty much costs you money and time, so trying to get some money back is understandable.

Wouldn’t it be an idea to close off parts of this forum to non-registered users in order to cut down traffic? This forum pretty much revolves around a small core, which has been the same for years.

Read full topic

item.title: Viglink?
item.dc:creator: @T41 t4
item.description:
@T41 wrote:

[quote=“Moparisthebest, post:9, topic:439943”]It’s not a virus, it’s something I enabled when I started using cloudflare on April 6th. I only enabled it on moparisthebest.com and moparcraft.net, not moparisthebest.com for now. There are a few reasons.

  1. For years now, moparisthebest.com (specifically, the server status page) provides all the revenue to pay for the hosting, moparisthebest.com doesn’t really contribute at all. For example, the last few months moparisthebest.com made something like $12 in adsense revenue.
  2. Since the latest version of chrome, it automatically blocks all google ads when you are using HTTPS, and google currently has no solution for this and doesn’t seem to be even the slightest bit concerned over it. I’d like to continue to provide HTTPS support, but if it cuts off all revenue I might have to drop it.
  3. Viglink doesn’t interfere with adsense, and you can completely opt-out of it by visiting the following link:
    http://www.viglink.com/support/optout

If any of you are wondering, to date VigLink has earned a total of 67 cents ($0.67 dollars) so far across both domains. So it doesn’t look like that good of a deal right now anyhow.

So, if any of you have other ideas, please let me know. I hope it doesn’t bother you guys, especially since it’s easy to opt-out of.[/quote]
uh, aren’t the mscp/mitb/minecraft shit all on the same server? if so, are you just in need of money for the domain it self? or what?

Read full topic

item.title: Viglink?
item.dc:creator: @NewbieNewty Newty
item.description:
@NewbieNewty wrote:

Why don’t you just use like 20 percent of the sponsored server money for your self and then take another 10 percent out to cover server cost. Then whatever is left over use to help the scene, like you already have been.

In my opinion all that money is yours to use for anything you want, you earned it. The fact that you use it to help the rsps and rs cheating communitys is pretty admirable in my opinion.

Read full topic

item.title: Viglink?
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

It’s not a virus, it’s something I enabled when I started using cloudflare on April 6th. I only enabled it on moparisthebest.com and moparcraft.net, not moparisthebest.com for now. There are a few reasons.

  1. For years now, moparisthebest.com (specifically, the server status page) provides all the revenue to pay for the hosting, moparisthebest.com doesn’t really contribute at all. For example, the last few months moparisthebest.com made something like $12 in adsense revenue.
  2. Since the latest version of chrome, it automatically blocks all google ads when you are using HTTPS, and google currently has no solution for this and doesn’t seem to be even the slightest bit concerned over it. I’d like to continue to provide HTTPS support, but if it cuts off all revenue I might have to drop it.
  3. Viglink doesn’t interfere with adsense, and you can completely opt-out of it by visiting the following link:
    http://www.viglink.com/support/optout

If any of you are wondering, to date VigLink has earned a total of 67 cents ($0.67 dollars) so far across both domains. So it doesn’t look like that good of a deal right now anyhow.

So, if any of you have other ideas, please let me know. I hope it doesn’t bother you guys, especially since it’s easy to opt-out of.

Read full topic

item.title: Viglink?
item.dc:creator: @bowserjr2 Bowser jr
item.description:
@bowserjr2 wrote:

Yes, it is something MITB have done.
Just check the HTML code.

<script type="text/javascript">
//<![CDATA[
window.__CF=window.__CF||{};window.__CF.AJS={"vig_key":{"sid":"8d5c066b337dc4e7a6bcdeba0de5f399"},"ga_key":{"ua":"UA-6877554-2","ga_bs":"1"}};
//]]>
</script>

You can disable it here: http://www.viglink.com/support/optout

Read full topic
